Basic details: Michael Thompson, a 52-year-old male, comes to the outpatient clinic complaining of bloody urine.
Vitals:
BP: 130/85 mm Hg
Temp: 98.7°F (37.1°C)
RR: 18/minute
HR: 78/minute, regular

Sitting on the examination table, looking anxious.
Frequently shifting in his seat.

Challenging question: "What could be causing this? Is it serious?"
